Description: Handle sliver of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine light purplish brown; cream slip. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 185, 13; the pattern of break does not suggest that there was chipping after Petrie drew the piece; rather he 'completed' line 3. Name Polyaratos. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0196.43 (where the remark regarding the sigma is an error).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1136)
